Package com.ee364project

Class Department

java.lang.Object
com.ee364project.Department
All Implemented Interfaces:
HasData
public class Department extends Object implements HasData
Represents a department implementing the HasData interface. This class provides methods for creating, retrieving, and manipulating Department objects.
Since:
2023-12-21
Version:
1.0
Author:
Team 2

  • Constructor Details

    • Department

      public Department(String name)
      Constructs a new department with the specified name. This constructor creates a new Department instance with the provided name. The department is added to the collection of all departments for easy retrieval.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new department.

    • Department

      public Department()
      Constructs a new department with a default name. This constructor creates a new Department instance with a default name, equivalent to calling the parameterized constructor with the default name provided by the Vars.NONE constant.

  • Method Details

    • easyNewDepartment

      public static Department easyNewDepartment(String name)
      Creates a new department with the specified name. This method provides a convenient way to instantiate a new Department object with the given name. It is designed for simplicity and is equivalent to calling the Department(String) constructor directly.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new department.
      Returns:
      A new Department instance with the specified name.
      See Also:
      • Department(String)

    • easyNewDepartment

      public static Department easyNewDepartment(Department department)
      Returns the provided department without creating a new instance. This method simply returns the same Department instance that is passed as a parameter. It is designed for cases where you want to provide a method that does not create a new department but returns an existing one.
      Parameters:
      department - The department to be returned.
      Returns:
      The same Department instance that is passed as a parameter.

    • getDepartment

      public static Department getDepartment(String name)
      Retrieves a department by its name, creating a new instance if not found. This method attempts to retrieve a Department instance from a collection of all departments based on the provided name. If a department with the given name is found, it is returned. Otherwise, a new Department instance is created with the provided name and added to the collection before being returned.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the department to retrieve or create.
      Returns:
      The Department instance associated with the provided name. If the department does not exist, a new instance with the provided name is created and returned.

    • getDepartment

      public static Department getDepartment()
      Retrieves a constant instance representing the absence of a department. This method returns a predefined constant instance of the Department class, indicating the absence of a specific department. It is useful when you want to represent scenarios where an object does not belong to any particular department. The constant instance returned by this method is shared among all callers and remains unchanged throughout the program's execution.
      Returns:
      The predefined instance representing the absence of a department.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the department.
      Returns:
      The name of the department.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representation of the department. This method generates a string containing the class name and the name of the department in a human-readable format. It is intended for debugging and logging purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string representation of the department.

    • getAllDepartments

      public static HashMap<String,Department> getAllDepartments()
      Retrieves a collection of all departments. This method returns a reference to the internal collection containing all department instances. It allows external access to the complete set of departments for informational or manipulative purposes.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing all departments, where keys are department names, and values are department instances.

    • getDataTypeName

      public String getDataTypeName()
      Retrieves the data type name associated with the department. This method returns the class name representing the data type of the department. It is used to identify the type of data when working with classes that implement the HasData interface.
      Specified by:
      getDataTypeName in interface HasData
      Returns:
      The data type name associated with the department.

    • getHeaders

      public String[] getHeaders()
      Retrieves the headers representing data fields in the department. This method returns an array of strings representing the headers or names of data fields associated with the department. It is used in conjunction with the getData method when working with classes that implement the HasData interface.
      Specified by:
      getHeaders in interface HasData
      Returns:
      An array of strings representing the headers of data fields in the department.

    • getData

      public String[][] getData()
      Retrieves the data representation of the department. This method returns a two-dimensional array of strings representing the data associated with the department. The array typically includes a row of headers obtained from the getHeaders method and a row of data fields.
      Specified by:
      getData in interface HasData
      Returns:
      A two-dimensional array of strings representing the data of the department.

    • parseData

      public Department parseData(String[] dataFields)
      Parses an array of data fields and updates the department's properties. This method takes an array of strings representing data fields and updates the properties of the department accordingly. The order and format of data fields should match the expected structure defined by the getHeaders and getData methods when working with classes that implement the HasData interface.
      Specified by:
      parseData in interface HasData
      Parameters:
      dataFields - An array of strings representing data fields for the department.
      Returns:
      The updated department instance.

    • shuffle

      public Department shuffle()
      Shuffles the department, updating its name with a random department name. This method removes the department from the collection of all departments, generates a new random industry name using a utility method, updates the department's name, and adds it back to the collection. It is designed for scenarios where a department's name needs to be refreshed randomly.
      Specified by:
      shuffle in interface HasData
      Returns:
      The updated department instance with a new random name.

    • getRandomDepartment

      public static Department getRandomDepartment()
      Retrieves a randomly selected department from the collection of all departments. This method returns a randomly selected Department instance from the collection of all departments. It is useful when you need to obtain a department at random for various scenarios, such as simulations or testing.
      Returns:
      A randomly selected Department instance.
